description.p: Taekwindow is a simple, lightweight and free Windows program that allows you to move and resize windows by dragging them with the Alt key, similar to many X11 window managers.

sysreqs.p: Taekwindow works on Windows XP and above (that is, Vista and 7), both 32-bits and 64-bits versions. It is tested on 32-bits Windows XP and 64-bits Windows 7.
Windows 2000 is no longer officially supported, but might still work.

ol.li: To install Taekwindow, simply extract the archive to any place you like. You need only the taekwindow.exe file to use the program.
Through the Preferences dialog, you can create a shortcut in the Startup section of your Start Menu, so Taekwindow is started when you log on to your computer.

usage.p: Start taekwindow.exe to load the program. A new icon will appear in the taskbar notification area (next to the clock, also known as the system tray). You can now do the following:

ul.li: Hold left Alt and drag a window with the left mouse button to move it. If you have multiple monitors, you can also move maximized windows between monitors in this way.
Hold left Alt and drag a window with the right mouse button to resize it. If you resize a maximized window, it will automatically be unmaximized.
Middle-click on the title bar of a window to push it to the background.
Use the scroll wheel on the window under the mouse cursor, instead of the window that happens to have the focus.

usage.p: The icon in the taskbar can be used in the following ways:

ul.li: Left-click the icon to completely disable all features of Taekwindow. Use this in case some application needs to handle the events that Taekwindow is catching, but you don't want to quit it completely. Left-click the icon again to re-enable.
Double-click the icon to open the Preferences dialog.
Right-click the icon to show a menu, through which you can enable/disable the program, open the Preferences dialog, and exit Taekwindow completely.

usage.p: To stop the program, use the icon in the taskbar notification area. In case you have turned the icon off in the Preferences dialog, just run taekwindow.exe again. It will not load itself, but rather stop the running instance and then quit. You can also stop it through the Task Manager if you prefer.

configuration.p: You can configure the program by right-clicking the notification area icon and choosing Preferences. This will open the Preferences dialog; its usage should be self-explanatory.

bugs.p: Please see the Bugs and feature requests tracker at SourceForge.
You can view the list of bugs in the current release as well as submit any new bugs you've discovered.

Apart from a list of planned features, this also contains all feature requests submitted by users. You can of course submit your own.

version.bugfix: the tray icon is now shown even if no settings are present in the registry
Google Talk now responds to move and resize actions
Google Chrome now responds to move and resize actions
the scroll wheel now works correctly in mIRC when it has the focus
Microsoft Word 2007 now moves and resizes correctly

version.feature: windows are no longer raised when they are moved or resized
windows are no longer activated when they are moved or resized
the scroll wheel optionally affects the window under the mouse cursor, instead of the focused window
maximized windows can now be moved across multiple monitors while remaining maximized
maximized windows can now be resized and will become unmaximized
a code overhaul should make it much easier to implement future improvements
version.bugfix: the error message “Specified cast is not valid” no longer appears when starting the configuration tool after an upgrade from 0.2.1 or earlier
pushing back an inactive window no longer raises the active one
Alt no longer “hangs” after returning to a desktop that was locked with Ctrl+Alt+Del

version.feature: added an optional system tray icon
the mouse cursor changes while moving or resizing
middle mouse click on the title bar pushes a window to the background
version.bugfix: when no settings are present in the registry, the configuration tool is now filled with default values instead of none at all
it is no longer possible to start multiple instances of the configuration tool
moving and resizing now works properly when dragging title bar or borders
moving and resizing now works on MDI child windows, instead of the parent
Taekwindow should no longer occasionally behave as if Alt is pressed when it is not

version.feature: made the modifier and mouse buttons, as well as closest-corner resizing, into options
added an option to the configuration tool for creating/deleting a Startup shortcut in the Start Menu
version.bugfix: The error message “This application has failed to start because the application configuration is incorrect. Reinstalling the application may fix this problem.” no longer appears.

version.feature: moving with Alt+left button, resizing from the bottom right corner with Alt+right button
